title: Asthma Care
description: Asthma is a chronic disease in which the bronchial airways in the lungs become narrowed and swollen, making it difficult to breathe.

title: Bronchoscopy
description: Bronchoscopy is a test to view the airways and diagnose lung disease. It may also be used during the treatment of some lung conditions.

title: Pneumonia
description: Pneumonia in children is an infection that inflames the air sacs in the lungs, leading to difficulty breathing, cough, and fever.

title: Tuberculosis TB
description: Tuberculosis (TB) is a contagious bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs, causing symptoms like persistent cough, fever, and weight loss.

title: Seasonal Allergies
description: Seasonal allergies, also known as hay fever, are allergic reactions triggered by pollen and other airborne allergens, leading to symptoms like sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes.

title: Hives/Urticaria
description: Urticaria, also known as hives, is a skin condition characterized by red, itchy welts that can appear anywhere on the body, often triggered by an allergic reaction.

title: Chronic Sinusitis
description: Chronic sinusitis is a long-lasting inflammation of the sinuses that leads to symptoms like nasal congestion, facial pain, and reduced sense of smell.

title: Eczema/Atopic Dermatitis
description: Eczema, or atopic dermatitis, is a chronic skin condition causing inflamed, itchy, and dry patches of skin, often triggered by allergens or irritants.

title: Food Allergies
description: Food allergies are immune system reactions to specific proteins in certain foods, causing symptoms like hives, swelling, or gastrointestinal issues after ingestion.
